instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not recognise SSD
threads.message:
goog afternoon, could you give me some guidance in that case? 
I don't know where to start, there are no signs of oxidation, sometimes you recognize the ssd.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not recognise SSD
threads.message:
We have several post about this issue on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.
Usually internal problem on CPU, or broken solder balls underneath.
Some videos reflowing CPU available on Internet.
Unfortunately that is not a serious solution :(-

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not recognise SSD
threads.message: if I reflow on the CPU will I get a solution ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not recognise SSD
threads.message:
"Unfortunately that is not a serious solution :(- "
You can try it on your risk.
Be aware, speak with the client first; you can get a completely dead board!

Some people say on Internet they had success puting entire board on IR oven.
Possibly someone already tried with pizza oven...
